description: From Middle English ofcutten, of-kitten, equivalent to off- +â€Ž cut.

adjectives.description: offcut (comparative more offcut, superlative most offcut)

examples: The PPITB's Education Service of the Plastics Industry (ESPI) believes that if there is to be sustained use of plastics in schools, there must be some support by industry to give schools access to offcut or surplus material for project [...]

entries.meaning: A piece that has been cut off of a larger piece when not needed; surplus.

verbs.description: offcut (third-person singular simple present offcuts, present participle offcutting, simple past and past participle offcut)

examples: Many stockholders operate in a restricted space and it is thus difficult to allocate much room to offcut storage.
